item.title: 德国内阁支持 2025 年预算草案和中期财政计划
item.description: 德国总理弗里德里希-梅尔茨（Friedrich Merz）内阁批准了政府 2025 年预算和中期财政计划，其中包括大幅增加新借款净额，以资助国家的军事建设。【原文：German Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s cabinet approved the government’s 2025 budget and medium-term finance plan, including a big increase in net new borrowing to help finance the country’s military buildup.】

item.title: 工党反叛者获得足够支持以阻止斯塔默的福利削减计划
item.description: 工党反对英国政府削减 50 亿英镑（约合 68 亿美元）残疾人福利金的人士已获得足够的支持来阻止这一计划，这是对上任不到一年的首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）领导能力的一次高风险考验。【原文：Labour party opponents of the UK government’s £5 billion ($6.8 billion) cut to disability benefits have secured enough support to block the plan, setting up a high-stakes test of Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s leadership less than a year into office.】

item.title: 与伊朗达成停火协议后以色列市场反弹
item.description: 在以色列确认与伊朗达成停火协议后，该国的股票、货币和债券在新兴市场中涨幅最大。【原文：Israel’s stocks, currency and bonds posted some of the biggest gains in emerging markets after the nation confirmed it has agreed a ceasefire with Iran.】

item.title: 德国与各州就分担减税负担达成协议
item.description: 德国执政联盟与各州州长就如何分担旨在促进经济增长的企业减税计划的财政负担达成了协议。【原文：Germany’s ruling coalition reached an agreement with the country’s state premiers on how to share the financial burden from planned corporate tax cuts meant to boost economic growth.】

item.title: 中东风险缓解，国债重拾财政担忧
item.description: 在以色列和伊朗之间的停火消除了笼罩在全球市场上空的风云之后，债券投资者又将注意力转移到了令人担忧的美国财政风险问题上。【原文：Bond investors are shifting their focus back to troubling questions about US fiscal risks, after a ceasefire between Israel and Iran cleared a stormcloud hanging over global markets.】

item.title: 谷歌在人工智能搜索摘要和广告方面面临英国压力
item.description: Alphabet Inc. 旗下的谷歌（Google）将面临英国反垄断监督机构要求其在线搜索和广告业务（包括人工智能生成的搜索回复）更加公平和透明的审查，此举可能使谷歌成为首家面临英国更严格数字规则诉讼的公司。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google will face the UK’s antitrust watchdog’s push for more fairness and transparency in its online search and advertising business, including in AI-generated search responses, in a move that could make it the first company to face action under tougher UK digital rules.】

item.title: 中国有望在年底前启动全国电力市场
item.description: 中国主要的电网运营商表示，中国将如期在今年年底前启动全国统一的电力交易市场。【原文：China is on target to launch a unified national power trading market by the end of this year, according to its main electricity grid operator.】

item.title: 评级下降，日本交易所首席执行官连任票数减少
item.description: 日本交易所集团（Japan Exchange Group Inc.【原文：Japan Exchange Group Inc. chief executive officer Hiromi Yamaji was re-elected with a smaller majority as his approval rating slid to the lowest ever and the bourse operator’s shares underperformed the market benchmark.】

item.title: CBA 市值突破 2,000 亿美元，股价涨势喜人
item.description: 澳大利亚联邦银行（Commonwealth Bank of Australia）的市值达到了一个新的里程碑，该股似乎没有受到近期地缘政治紧张局势对股市造成的冲击。【原文：Commonwealth Bank of Australia’s market value hit a fresh milestone, with the stock seemingly undeterred by recent geopolitical tensions that have rattled equity markets.】

item.title: 英国富时 100 指数直播：特朗普称以色列与伊朗停火协议生效，股市和英镑上涨
澳大利亚最大的铁矿石出口枢纽五月份创下历史最繁忙纪录
item.description: 即使在 2025 年早些时候天气问题抑制了出口之后，最大的散装出口码头的铁矿石装运量仍创下了 5 月份的最高纪录，达到了今年迄今为止的最大流量。【原文：Iron ore shipments from the largest bulk-export terminal set a record for the month of May, putting flows at the biggest year-to-date volumes even after weather issues curbed exports earlier in 2025.】

item.title: 风险投资公司 Project A 为欧洲金融科技、人工智能和国防领域的初创企业募集 3.25 亿欧元基金
item.description: 德国风险投资公司 Project A 早期押注于国防初创企业，该公司募集了 3.25 亿欧元（3.73 亿美元）的基金，用于支持欧洲企业。【原文：Project A, a German venture capital firm that has placed early bets on defense startups, raised a €325 million ($373 million) fund to back European companies.】

item.title: 应对关税的南非汽车企业面临薪酬谈判考验
item.description: 南非汽车业工人加薪问题可能陷入僵局，这有可能导致占全国制造业产量五分之一以上的汽车业停产，给本已奄奄一息的经济雪上加霜。【原文：A potential deadlock over pay increases for South Africa’s automotive sector workers risks shutting down an industry that accounts for more than a fifth of the nation’s manufacturing output, weighing on an already moribund economy.】

item.title: 印度微型公司股票涨势或因盈利和零售业利益而延续
item.description: 在盈利改善和散户投资者资金流入的推动下，印度微型市值股票将迎来一年来最强劲的一个季度。【原文：Micro-cap stocks in India are poised for their strongest quarter in a year, propelled by improving earnings and inflows from retail investors.】

item.title: 需求疲软影响利润，中国炼油企业暂缓采购
item.description: 中国的炼油企业对全球原油市场保持观望态度，因为地缘政治的发展扰乱了油价，而国内需求的疲软又削弱了他们的盈利能力。【原文：China’s oil refiners are keeping to the sidelines of global crude markets, as geopolitical developments roil prices and weaker domestic demand eats into their profitability.】

item.title: 前高官称中国即将迎来超过 100 次深空探测
item.description: 据一位前高级官员称，中国在发展人工智能方面的优势即将掀起一股创新浪潮，在未来 18 个月内将产生 100 多项类似 DeepSeek 的突破。【原文：China’s advantages in developing artificial intelligence are about to unleash a wave of innovation that will generate more than 100 DeepSeek-like breakthroughs in the coming 18 months, according to a former top official.】

item.title: 养老金问题再次凸显，法国政府面临压力测试
item.description: 法国有争议的退休改革谈判周一陷入僵局，如果反对党联合起来进行不信任投票，政府垮台的可能性就会增加。【原文：Negotiations over France’s contentious retirement reform ended in deadlock Monday, raising the chances of government collapse should opposition parties unite in a no-confidence vote.】

item.title: 塔塔资本 20 亿美元首次公开募股据称将获 SEBI 批准
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，塔塔资本有限公司（Tata Capital Ltd.）已获得印度市场监管机构的批准，继续推进其首次公开募股计划，预计将获得约 20 亿美元的资金，这将是印度今年最大的一次上市。【原文：Tata Capital Ltd. received the approval of India’s markets regulator to proceed with its plans for an initial public offering that may fetch about $2 billion, according to people familiar with the matter, in what is expected to be the country’s biggest listing this year.】

item.title: 维勒鲁瓦告诉《金融时报》，欧洲央行仍有可能在未来六个月内降息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员弗朗索瓦-维勒罗伊-德-加尔豪告诉《金融时报》，欧洲中央银行仍有可能在未来半年内降息。【原文：The European Central Bank could still cut interest rates in the next half year, Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau told the Financial Times.】

item.title: 特朗普说结束就结束了吗？我们拭目以待
item.description:
油价迫不及待地再次下跌，但目前还不清楚伊朗到底同意了什么。【原文：

Oil prices couldn’t wait to fall again, but it’s unclear what Iran has really agreed to.

item.title: 上周降息后，苏格兰国家银行今年利率将保持在零水平
item.description: 大多数经济学家认为，瑞士国家银行今年可能不会采取行动，威胁将借贷成本降至零以下。【原文：The Swiss National Bank probably won’t act this year on its threat of cutting borrowing costs to below zero, according to a majority of economists.】

item.title: 决策指南》：匈牙利将维持利率不变，因为价格抑制措施效果不佳
item.description: 匈牙利央行可能连续第九个月维持其关键利率不变，在地缘政治风险日益加剧和通胀预期持续走高的情况下保持稳定。【原文：Hungary’s central bank is likely to keep its key interest rate unchanged for a ninth month, holding steady amid mounting geopolitical risks and persistently high inflation expectations.】

item.title: 日本出售 20 年期债券表明市场仍对长期债券持谨慎态度
item.description: 即使在政府调整借贷计划以平息收益率飙升之后，日本 20 年期债券销售的需求仍略低于过去一年的平均水平，这表明投资者仍持谨慎态度。【原文：Demand at Japan’s 20-year bond sale was slightly lower than the average over the past year even after the government adjusted its borrowing plans to calm a surge in yields, indicating that investors are still cautious.】

item.title: 摩根大通认为亚洲科技股今年将再涨 15-20
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：Asian technology stocks may rally another 15%-20% this year, driven mainly by the strong momentum in the artificial intelligence space, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.】

item.title: 韩国对资助有本国企业参与的印度造船厂持开放态度
item.description: 据知情人士透露，韩国政府支持的两家贷款机构愿意向愿意与东亚国家造船厂合作的印度造船厂提供廉价贷款。【原文：Two South Korean government-backed lenders are open to providing cheap loans to Indian shipyards that are willing to partner with the east Asian nation’s shipbuilders, according to people familiar.】

item.title: 日本赤泽表示仍在努力确定下一次贸易谈判的日期
item.description: 随着避免再次加征关税协议的最后期限临近，日本和美国仍在努力确定下一轮内阁级贸易谈判的时间。【原文：Japan and the US are still working on setting the timing for the next round of cabinet-level trade talks, Japan’s point person for the negotiations said, as the deadline for a deal to avert another hike in tariffs nears.】

item.title: 中东紧张局势因停火而缓和，新兴资产获得收益
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布以色列和伊朗停火后，新兴市场资产走高，提振了整个地区的风险情绪。【原文：Emerging market assets advanced after US President Donald Trump announced a ceasefire between Israel and Iran, bolstering risk sentiment across the region.】

item.title: 日本寻求更大市场，发行商提供罕见的债券保障措施
item.description: 两家日本公司出售了为投资者提供保护的债券，使其免受公司收购等事件的影响，这种罕见的举动反映出决策者希望扩大市场，将风险较高的借款人纳入其中。【原文：Two Japanese companies sold bonds that offer protection for investors against events like corporate takeovers, in rare moves that reflect the desire of policymakers to broaden the market to include riskier borrowers.】

item.title: 据说黄金矿商山金将选择银行在香港上市
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，山金国际黄金股份有限公司（Shanjin International Gold Co.【原文：Shanjin International Gold Co. has picked banks for a Hong Kong listing, according to people familiar with the matter, as the Chinese miner seeks to take advantage of high bullion prices.】

item.title: 韩国贸易代表在与美国的首次会谈中寻求关税减免
item.description: 韩国贸易部长杨汉九（Yeo Han-koo）在上任后首次与美国贸易部长会晤后表示，韩国再次呼吁免除美国关税，包括影响汽车和钢铁等关键行业的关税。【原文：South Korea reiterated its call to be exempted from US tariffs including duties affecting key industries such as cars and steel, Trade Minister Yeo Han-koo said after his first meeting with US counterparts since taking up his position.】
